products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-pvs-inf
products.label: Power infrastructure for deployable architectures
products.short_description: Deploy Power Systems Virtual Server workspace as an extension of a secure VPC. On top of this infrastructure additional deployable architectures like SAP on Power might be deployed.
products.long_description:
# IBM Cloud catalog example for Power infrastructure for deployable architectures Full-Stack Variation This example sets up the following infrastructure: - A VPC Infrastructure with the following components: - Provisions three VPCs with one VSI in each VPC (one management(jump/bastion) VSI, one inet-svs VSI configured as squid proxy server, one private-svs VSI configured as NFS, NTP, DNS server). - Installs and configures the Squid Proxy, DNS Forwarder, NTP forwarder and NFS on hosts, and sets the host as the server for the NTP, NFS, and DNS services by using Ansible roles. - A PowerVS workspace instance with the following network topology: - Creates two private networks: a management network and a backup network. - Creates one or two IBM Cloud connections. - Attaches the IBM Cloud connections to a transit gateway. - Attaches the private networks to the IBM Cloud connections. - Creates an SSH key. ## Architecture diagram ![full-stack-variation](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-powervs-infrastructure/blob/main/reference-architectures/full-stack/deploy-arch-ibm-pvs-inf-full-stack.svg) ## Requirements | Name | Version | |------|---------| | [terraform](#requirement\_terraform) | >= 1.3.0 | | [ibm](#requirement\_ibm) | >=1.49.0 | ## Modules | Name | Source | Version | |------|--------|---------| | [landing\_zone](#module\_landing\_zone) | git::https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-landing-zone.git//patterns//vsi | v2.0.0 | | [powervs\_infra](#module\_powervs\_infra) | ../../../../ | n/a | ## Resources No resources. ## Inputs | Name | Description | Type | Default | Required | |------|-------------|------|---------|:--------:| | [IC\_SCHEMATICS\_WORKSPACE\_ID](#input\_IC\_SCHEMATICS\_WORKSPACE\_ID) | leave blank if running locally. This variable will be automatically populated if running from an IBM Cloud Schematics workspace | `string` | `""` | no | | [cloud\_connection](#input\_cloud\_connection) | Cloud connection configuration: speed (50, 100, 200, 500, 1000, 2000, 5000, 10000 Mb/s), count (1 or 2 connections), global\_routing (true or false), metered (true or false) | 
object({
    count          = number
    speed          = number
    global_routing = bool
    metered        = bool
  })
| 
{
  "count": 2,
  "global_routing": true,
  "metered": true,
  "speed": 5000
}
| no | | [configure\_dns\_forwarder](#input\_configure\_dns\_forwarder) | Specify if DNS forwarder will be configured. This will allow you to use central DNS servers (e.g. IBM Cloud DNS servers) sitting outside of the created IBM PowerVS infrastructure. If yes, ensure 'dns\_forwarder\_config' optional variable is set properly. DNS forwarder will be installed on the private-svs vsi. | `bool` | `true` | no | | [configure\_nfs\_server](#input\_configure\_nfs\_server) | Specify if NFS server will be configured. This will allow you easily to share files between PowerVS instances (e.g., SAP installation files). NFS server will be installed on the private-svs vsi. | `bool` | `true` | no | | [configure\_ntp\_forwarder](#input\_configure\_ntp\_forwarder) | Specify if NTP forwarder will be configured. This will allow you to synchronize time between IBM PowerVS instances. NTP forwarder will be installed on the private-svs vsi. | `bool` | `true` | no | | [dns\_forwarder\_config](#input\_dns\_forwarder\_config) | Configuration for the DNS forwarder to a DNS service that is not reachable directly from PowerVS. | 
object({
    dns_servers = string
  })
| 
{
  "dns_servers": "161.26.0.7; 161.26.0.8; 9.9.9.9;"
}
| no | | [ibmcloud\_api\_key](#input\_ibmcloud\_api\_key) | The IBM Cloud platform API key needed to deploy IAM enabled resources. | `string` | `null` | no | | [powervs\_backup\_network](#input\_powervs\_backup\_network) | Name of the IBM Cloud PowerVS backup network and CIDR to create. | 
object({
    name = string
    cidr = string
  })
| 
{
  "cidr": "10.52.0.0/24",
  "name": "bkp_net"
}
| no | | [powervs\_image\_names](#input\_powervs\_image\_names) | List of Images to be imported into cloud account from catalog images | `list(string)` | 
[
  "SLES15-SP3-SAP",
  "SLES15-SP3-SAP-NETWEAVER",
  "RHEL8-SP4-SAP",
  "RHEL8-SP4-SAP-NETWEAVER"
]
| no | | [powervs\_management\_network](#input\_powervs\_management\_network) | Name of the IBM Cloud PowerVS management subnet and CIDR to create. | 
object({
    name = string
    cidr = string
  })
| 
{
  "cidr": "10.51.0.0/24",
  "name": "mgmt_net"
}
| no | | [powervs\_resource\_group\_name](#input\_powervs\_resource\_group\_name) | Existing IBM Cloud resource group name. | `string` | n/a | yes | | [powervs\_zone](#input\_powervs\_zone) | IBM Cloud data center location where IBM PowerVS infrastructure will be created. | `string` | n/a | yes | | [prefix](#input\_prefix) | A unique identifier for resources. Must begin with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or number. This prefix will be prepended to any resources provisioned by this template. Prefixes must be 16 or fewer characters. | `string` | n/a | yes | | [preset](#input\_preset) | Use one of supported [configurations](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-powervs-infrastructure/tree/main/examples/ibm-catalog/presets/slz_json_configs_for_powervs). Copy the configuration from the link into the `preset` deployment value. | `string` | n/a | yes | | [ssh\_private\_key](#input\_ssh\_private\_key) | Private SSH key (RSA format) used to login to IBM PowerVS instances. Should match to public SSH key referenced by 'ssh\_public\_key'. Entered data must be in [heredoc strings format](https://www.terraform.io/language/expressions/strings#heredoc-strings). The key is not uploaded or stored. For more information about SSH keys, see [SSH keys](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-ssh-keys). | `string` | n/a | yes | | [ssh\_public\_key](#input\_ssh\_public\_key) | Public SSH Key for VSI creation. Must be an RSA key with a key size of either 2048 bits or 4096 bits (recommended). Must be a valid SSH key that does not already exist in the deployment region. | `string` | n/a | yes | | [tags](#input\_tags) | List of tag names for the IBM Cloud PowerVS workspace | `list(string)` | 
[
  "sap"
]
| no | ## Outputs | Name | Description | |------|-------------| | [access\_host\_or\_ip](#output\_access\_host\_or\_ip) | Access host(jump/bastion) for created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [cloud\_connection\_count](#output\_cloud\_connection\_count) | Number of cloud connections configured in created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [dns\_host\_or\_ip](#output\_dns\_host\_or\_ip) | DNS forwarder host for created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [nfs\_path](#output\_nfs\_path) | NFS host for created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [ntp\_host\_or\_ip](#output\_ntp\_host\_or\_ip) | NTP host for created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [powervs\_backup\_network\_name](#output\_powervs\_backup\_network\_name) | Name of backup network in created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [powervs\_management\_network\_name](#output\_powervs\_management\_network\_name) | Name of management network in created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [powervs\_resource\_group\_name](#output\_powervs\_resource\_group\_name) | IBM Cloud resource group where PowerVS infrastructure is created. | | [powervs\_sshkey\_name](#output\_powervs\_sshkey\_name) | SSH public key name in created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [powervs\_workspace\_name](#output\_powervs\_workspace\_name) | PowerVS infrastructure workspace name. | | [powervs\_zone](#output\_powervs\_zone) | Zone where PowerVS infrastructure is created. | | [prefix](#output\_prefix) | The prefix that is associated with all resources | | [proxy\_host\_or\_ip\_port](#output\_proxy\_host\_or\_ip\_port) | Proxy host:port for created PowerVS infrastructure. | | [schematics\_workspace\_id](#output\_schematics\_workspace\_id) | ID of the IBM Cloud Schematics workspace. Returns null if not ran in Schematics | | [transit\_gateway\_name](#output\_transit\_gateway\_name) | The name of the transit gateway. | | [vpc\_names](#output\_vpc\_names) | A list of the names of the VPC. | | [vsi\_list](#output\_vsi\_list) | A list of VSI with name, id, zone, and primary ipv4 address, VPC Name, and floating IP. | | [vsi\_names](#output\_vsi\_names) | A list of the vsis names provisioned within the VPCs. |

features.description: A Power Virtual Server is deployed as the extension of the VPC environment created previously.
features.title: Creates Power Virtual Server

features.description: Internet proxy based on SQUID, NFS server, NTP forwarder, and DNS forwarder.
features.title: Configures management services on virtual server instances in your environment

flavors.label: PowerVS workspace (incl. Secure Landing Zone)
flavors.name: full-stack
flavors.usage_template:
module "power-infrastructure" {
  source =                     "https://cm.globalcatalog.cloud.ibm.com/api/v1-beta/offering/source//${{workingDirectory}}?archive=tgz&flavor=${{flavor}}&kind=${{kind}}&name=${{name}}&version=${{version}}"
  powervs_zone                = var.powervs_zone
  powervs_resource_group_name  = var.powervs_resource_group_name
  prefix                  = var.prefix
  preset = var.preset
  ssh_private_key             = var.ssh_private_key
  ssh_public_key              = var.ssh_public_key
  }

configuration.description: IBM Cloud data center location where IBM PowerVS infrastructure will be created.
Existing IBM Cloud resource group name.

A unique identifier for resources. Must begin with a lowercase letter and end with a lowercase letter or number. This prefix will be prepended to any resources provisioned by this template. Prefixes must be 16 or fewer characters.

Use one of supported [configurations](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-powervs-infrastructure/tree/main/examples/ibm-catalog/presets/slz-for-powervs). Copy the configuration from the link into the `preset` deployment value.
Public SSH Key for VSI creation. Must be an RSA key with a key size of either 2048 bits or 4096 bits (recommended). Must be a valid SSH key that does not already exist in the deployment region.

configuration.default_value:
<<-EOF
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
EOF
configuration.description: Private SSH key (RSA format) used to login to IBM PowerVS instances. Should match to public SSH key referenced by 'ssh_public_key'. Entered data must be in [heredoc strings format](https://www.terraform.io/language/expressions/strings#heredoc-strings). The key is not uploaded or stored. For more information about SSH keys, see [SSH keys](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-ssh-keys).

Specify if DNS forwarder will be configured. This will allow you to use central DNS servers (e.g. IBM Cloud DNS servers) sitting outside of the created IBM PowerVS infrastructure. If yes, ensure 'dns_forwarder_config' optional variable is set properly. DNS forwarder will be installed on the private-svs vsi.
Specify if NFS server will be configured. This will allow you easily to share files between PowerVS instances (e.g., SAP installation files). NFS server will be installed on the private-svs vsi.
Specify if NTP forwarder will be configured. This will allow you to synchronize time between IBM PowerVS instances. NTP forwarder will be installed on the private-svs vsi.
Name of the IBM Cloud PowerVS management subnet and CIDR to create.
Name of the IBM Cloud PowerVS backup network and CIDR to create.
List of Images to be imported into cloud account from catalog images
Cloud connection configuration: speed (50, 100, 200, 500, 1000, 2000, 5000, 10000 Mb/s), count (1 or 2 connections), global_routing (true or false), metered (true or false)
Configuration for the DNS forwarder to a DNS service that is not reachable directly from PowerVS.
List of tag names for the IBM Cloud PowerVS workspace

DNS forwarder host for created PowerVS infrastructure.

A list of the names of the VPC.

A list of VSI with name, id, zone, and primary ipv4 address, VPC Name, and floating IP.
Name of backup network in created PowerVS infrastructure.
NTP host for created PowerVS infrastructure.
NFS host for created PowerVS infrastructure.
IBM Cloud resource group where PowerVS infrastructure is created.
Number of cloud connections configured in created PowerVS infrastructure.
The prefix that is associated with all resources
PowerVS infrastructure workspace name.
The name of the transit gateway.
Access host(jump/bastion) for created PowerVS infrastructure.
ID of the IBM Cloud Schematics workspace. Returns null if not ran in Schematics
A list of the vsis names provisioned within the VPCs.

diagram.caption: Power infrastructure for deployable architectures 'full-stack' variation

diagrams.description:
The 'full stack' variation of the Power Infrastructure for deployable architectures creates a Power Virtual Server workspace and connects it with VPC services.
 
A proxy service for public internet access from the PowerVS workspace is configured. You can optionally configure some management components on VPC (such as an NFS server, NTP forwarder, and DNS forwarder).

configuration.description: IBM Cloud Schematics workspace ID of an existing Secure infrastructure on VPC for regulated industries with VSIs deployment. If you do not yet have an existing deployment, click [here](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/content/slz-vpc-with-vsis-a87ed9a5-d130-47a3-980b-5ceb1d4f9280-global#create) to create one. When you deploy this module, use one of supported [configurations](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-powervs-infrastructure/tree/main/examples/ibm-catalog/presets/slz-for-powervs). Copy the configuration from the link into the `override_json_string` deployment value.
IBM Cloud data center location where IBM PowerVS infrastructure will be created.
Existing IBM Cloud resource group name.
Name of the IBM Cloud PowerVS management subnet and CIDR to create.
Name of the IBM Cloud PowerVS backup network and CIDR to create.
Cloud connection configuration: speed (50, 100, 200, 500, 1000, 2000, 5000, 10000 Mb/s), count (1 or 2 connections), global_routing (true or false), metered (true or false)
List of Images to be imported into cloud account from catalog images
List of tag names for the IBM Cloud PowerVS workspace

Private SSH key (RSA format) used to login to IBM PowerVS instances. Should match to uploaded public SSH key referenced by 'ssh_public_key'. Entered data must be in [heredoc strings format](https://www.terraform.io/language/expressions/strings#heredoc-strings). The key is not uploaded or stored. For more information about SSH keys, see [SSH keys](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-ssh-keys).

Specify if proxy will be configured. Proxy is mandatory for the landscape, so set this to 'false' only if proxy already exists. Proxy will allow to communicate from IBM PowerVS instances with IBM Cloud network and with public internet. SSH private key must be provided.

Specify if DNS forwarder will be configured. This will allow you to use central DNS servers (e.g. IBM Cloud DNS servers) sitting outside of the created IBM PowerVS infrastructure. If yes, ensure 'dns_forwarder_config' optional variable is set properly. DNS forwarder will be installed on the private-svs vsi. SSH private key must be provided.

Specify if NFS server will be configured. This will allow you easily to share files between PowerVS instances (e.g., SAP installation files). NFS server will be installed on the private-svs vsi. SSH private key must be provided.

Specify if NTP forwarder will be configured. This will allow you to synchronize time between IBM PowerVS instances. NTP forwarder will be installed on the private-svs vsi. SSH private key must be provided.
Configuration for the DNS forwarder to a DNS service that is not reachable directly from PowerVS.
The IBM Cloud platform API key needed to deploy IAM enabled resources.

diagram.caption: Power infrastructure for deployable architectures 'extension' variation

diagrams.description:
The 'extension' variation of the Power Infrastructure for deployable architectures creates a Power Virtual Server workspace and connects it with VPC services. It builds on the VPC service that you created when you deployed Secure infrastructure on VPC for regulated industries or the 'full stack' variation of the Power Infrastructure for deployable architecture.

A proxy service for public internet access from the PowerVS workspace is configured. You can optionally configure some management components on VPC (such as an NFS server, NTP forwarder, and DNS forwarder).
